medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began two days prior, starting as periumbilical pain that progressed to the right lower quadrant/suprapubic region. Nausea and bilious emesis developed after pain onset. Last bowel movement and flatus were the day before presentation. Associated chills and subjective fevers reported, along with urinary retention symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: TIA, Hypertension, Diabetes mellitus, Hypothyroidism, Gout, Manic/depressive disorder
